Query: Fetch a specific branch using git

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_7357624: How to get the removed branches in git
so_58772067: Why doesn't the GitHub API return all branches for a repository?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_58772067: curl -Lv 'http://api.github.com/repos/bminor/glibc/branches?per_page=100'

$ curl -sL 'http://api.github.com/repos/bminor/glibc/branches?page=2&per_page=100' \
      | jq -r '.[] | select(.name | contains("release")).name'
hjl/release/2.20/master
hjl/x32/release/2.12
hjl/x32/release/2.15

Explanations about Options.-s:
Silent or quiet mode. Don't show progress meter or error messages. Makes Curl
 mute. It will still output the data you ask for, potentially even to the
 terminal/stdout unless you redirect it.

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_52665082: Downloading a specific file from Repository (Like Bit bucket) using Powershell
so_43431277: Get remote name from local branch
ul_131089: Fetching all Git repositories in the background
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_131089: savelog -n -c 400 ~/log/git-fetch.log
find ~/git -type d -execdir [ -d '{}/.git' ]  \; -print -prune |
    parallel --gnu --keep-order \
    "date; echo {}; cd {}; git fetch --all --verbose" \
    >> ~/log/git-fetch.log 2>&1

Explanations about Options.-c:
Save cycle versions of the logfile (default: 7). The cycle count must be at least
 2.
